newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek seamen extend strike to Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Greek seamen extend strike to Tuesday.

text.p: Striking Greek seamen, who have kept most cargo and passenger ships docked for the past five days, said on Friday they would extend their strike for another four days.
"The strike was extended to Tuesday morning. Our struggle continues until the government satisfies our demands," a seamen's union representative told reporters.
The strike, which affects all ships with Greek crews, had been due to end early on Friday.
Police have reported minor clashes in ports around the country between passengers, lorry drivers and the striking seamen, who are pressing for better insurance, pension and tax benefits.
A telephone recording at the main port of Piraeus informed callers that no ships were sailing because of the strike.
Talks between the Panhellenic Seamen's Federation (PNO) and merchant marine ministry officials on Thursday were unsuccessful, union representatives said.
Owners of passenger ships have tried to declare the strike illegal and a court decision was expected later on Friday or on Saturday.
Civil aviation employees, pushing to maintain tax breaks which the government plans to abolish, also called for two four-hour stoppages on Friday and Sunday.
Airport officials said many local and international flights would be delayed.
